I tried the medium buffalo but I'm looking forward to trying other flavors...................

Yea, this was NOT a great experience.  

A group of us went yesterday around 11:30 and apparently they had just opened.  The tables and chairs were all wet from the recent wash down on the patio so after drying things off, we finally sat down. 

About 10 minutes later, a server stopped by (we were the only group there by the way) and asked if we would like drinks.  Yep... most of us ordered beer from the tap.  10 minutes later, we get our drinks.  

It was a half hour later, I went searching and asked him to come back and take an order for food.  We all placed order for appetizers.

Half hour more passes..... nothing.... we ask for the appetizers and got some Ore Ida Tater Tots and tacos that Taco Bell could have beat.

Needless to say - I'm not going back and unless the management figures it out, I'm very sure many others feel the same.

I wish this bar wasn't in the middle of nowhere. 

I like The Monastery. The crowd is chill although there isn't much socializing at the bars. I have not (nor do I plan to) played volley ball during the weekend tournaments but there are always tons of people on or around the courts. 

There is a live band on Saturday nights and they are pretty consistent. You know the usual: 40 something rhythm section with a Female lead rocking a tambourine.  Of  course not everyone loves all the music being performed. I listen to everything so I had no complaints about any of the songs being sung,. But I did hear some murmurs in the crowd and requests for more JIMI HENDRIX! 

Big downer. They only serve beer, wine and premixed margaritas. 
Big Ups: Cheapo  pitchers . YAY
Something Weird: They have a menu but you have to prepare your own food on the outdoor grill. 5 dollars for a cheeseburger and I have grill my own stuff. grrr. They could at least spring for higher quality beef. 
Plus Side of cooking at the outdoor grill is yucking it up with my fellow bar patrons. 

Nothing about the bar made me feel ill at ease. I have enjoyed my visits thus far. 

Oh and one more thing- If you drive to the bar and your Designated Driver drinks to much you can get a free cab ride home. Now you HAVE to have driven to the bar, not cabbed it. Some people complain about the false advertisement. You ask what the stipulations are before you decide to get ripped.

The service here is terrible. I hate how people can smoke here (doesn't make sense to have physical activities and smokers in the same spot). My mother had her 50th birthday party here. I had a lot of fun playing the bean bag toss, horse shoes, ping pong, and sand volleyball. On a November night, it is freezing! The band was terrible and could only play 1 genre- undanceable rock music. Plus there were like these floozy 40 year olds trying to dance sexy and it just made the place look trashy. So a waitress takes orders on our food and she brought it out 30 minutes later and still uncooked. She only brought out the chicken tacos cooked. I would have cooked my food sooner had I known that she was just bringing it out and going to take half an hour. Never came to check out on us and didn't really let us know what we could order. The bartender was great, but the service is not. The food is ok. NOT vegetarian friendly in terms of cooking your food on a meat cooked grill. They have a veggie burger and foil, but no veggie thongs to turn over the veggie burger and no clear definitions of what sauces have meat products in them. I'd never come back here unless my mom paid for me again.

great place for adults and for families! they have great food, the cheesy fries are crispy and gooood! the burgers too are awesome, and they have one of my fave foods: deep fried cheese curds ...yummm!
it gets quite crowded in the evenings and there have been many birthday and going away parties held here. we always sit in Ashley's sectionshe is very friendly and efficient  be sure to try an 'angry balls' drink: it's hard apple cider and cinnamon whisky..delicious and refreshing

The bartender's rock!! Thanks Will!! Their website SUCKS!!! Can you say, "FALSE ADVERTISING"? I thought you could. Their website states, "Ask your server for a free taxi." What they REALLY mean to say is..."if you drive your own vehicle to the bar, they will give you a ride back to your car in the morning for "FREE"....which is standard policy with Discount Cab at ALL bars.....you still have to pay for the taxi cab ride home. If you're going to abide by their policy, you should just use The Drunk Driver's. Their service is much more cost effect than The Monastery's "free taxi" service. DO NOT GO TO THE MONASTERY WITH THE INTENT OF BEING RESPONSIBLE AND USING THEIR "FREE" TAXI SERVICE.  What a joke!!!!!!!!!!!!

So I went here for the first time last night for the BF's birthday with some friends. It was a lot of fun! I loved all of the activities, we played horseshoes and other people were playing volleyball, pingpong, and some bean bag game. The alcohol was fine, nothing to get too excited about, but I don't think this is the kind of bar to go for specialty drinks or anything.... it's about hanging out with friends and playing games (for free :-)). I did have one of their frozen daiquiri's, and man, it had quite a bit of alcohol in it. There were some interesting characters here last night...They had some cover band of Jimmy Buffett or something, so there were a lot of older people (dressed in too skimpy clothes, but that's their prerogative). We grilled our own cheeseburgers and that was fun. They provide a bunch of different seasonings for the burgers and then also a bunch of toppings. They also offer to grill it for you if you don't feel like grilling it yourself. Overall, it was a really fun place and I would like to go back.

 Also, as far as having kids leave after 8, I was surprised there were kids there to begin with.... it is a bar after all. I think all bars have some time limit where kids can't be around anymore, and I think that's for the best.... who wants kids at a bar? And also, it could be an unsafe environment for a child anyway.

This place keeps getting worse and worse. Slowest service EVER! Came for some drinks and was told the person to access the taps won't be here until 3. That's just one example. Someone needs to buy this place and actually teach people how to run it.

At first I thought i was back in a ski lodge in Missoula MT. Very cool place. For all different kinds of people. There was an outdoor bar with live band, vollyball courts, and indoor bar. The wings were very good and prices were good too. The service was good. I would go again but go with an open mind.

Came with a group of people to introduce them to a neighborhood place we'd been to before. We were embarrassed that we suggested the place. The waitress provided horrible service....we had to constantly flag her down or go to the bar for our own drinks. We waited 55 min. for food to come out. It wasn't very busy and the food was basic bar food. When we brought our concerns to the manager ( who was also tending bar ), he had nothing to say and didn't seem to care. During the conversation he took our drink order, turned around and helped 4 others who came in after us instead of pouring our drinks.  We opted not to spend another dime, cashed out and left. They lost 11 customers that night.

A friend of mine booked an all age event here weeks in advance. The moment we arrived  anyone under the age of 21 was refused entry. I just can't figure out why there were so many children running around??!!!! The owner/ manager at the time couldn't even come to the door herself to let us know why all of a sudden there was an age requirement. Very unprofessional!!!! It is clear we were being discriminated! If your neck is not red, you don't belong here.

I was brought here since I was 10 and it is still the place I come to on Sunday's for family volleyball. It is an awesome place to bring friends for relaxing, watching a sports game, listening to live music, and play recreational volleyball!

They have good food at decent prices and certain days they have good specials on beer. You have to be 21 or be with a parent to get in as it is a bar.

They have league volleyball on certain nights and I know Sunday's it's open court. 
They also have lots of games to keep your kids busy and they are pet friendly! 

Well known spot for bikers to come and relax and have drinks as well as lovers of outdoors and volleyball.

Unique atmosphere. Volleyball outside with other games. Sweet! Everything was going great until we went to the bar. When I go to a bar I expect a 'hey how are you! Let's make your night great so you buy a shit ton of drinks!'. All we received was 'oh I heard you were looking for a good night! We'll drink your beer and go the f*ck home'.

I've always said this place has had great potential, unfortunately for me it's never lived up to it. Went there last night for cinco de mayo since they were opening up their "taco shop" and it was a local place. The place has a lively atmosphere, there usually is a lot of kids so it your looking to get "turnt up" then you should turn around.. Hahaha! Anyhoo, they had a do playing the most invigorating and popular hip-hop music including none other then the legend himself Will Smith! It made for a confusing night wondering if it was cinco de mayo, or the dj just for it his other computer with the mexican music. We hung out by the volleyball courts which they have 2 of. Had a few beers, stopped into a empty inside bar area where I considered ordering 2 tacos for 6.99. My first thought was "damn, are these made from a sacred cow" but then I figured they were just probably so big and amazing so I pulled the trigger. Worst 7 dollars I spent since buying 24 miniature lick on tattoos from a machine in front of frys, because I had to have the panther fighting the python. The tacos were dry, the amount of meat made me think we were in walking dead and they had to ration it.... I chewed on the same square of meat 4 times before swallowing it just so I could feel like I got my money worth. The dj wrapped it up around 930, which blew because I was starting to get jiggy with it... When the dj called it a night so did it, and went to another livelier place. This place is alright if you want to get out of the house and enjoy the weather and play outdoor games (horseshoes, bags, volleyball), and relax with family and close friends but if your looking to not deal with children, and have a great time and meet new people of go elsewhere. I don't want to bag on this place to much. I have had burgers on the past that you cook yourself that are delicious (probably because you cook them yourself) but it is a chill place. I may just bee too social, for this place...

The Monastery could be an amazing hangout in Northeast Mesa...but it's just not that great. It's such a unique outdoor venue, but the service is so poor I always wonder why we return. 

Pros: 
-They allow kids.
-It's a very cool outdoor space with volleyball, horseshoes, ping pong, and fire pits.
-Live music on the weekends.
-You can bring the dog.

Cons-
-They allow kids. Yes, I know I listed that as a "pro."
-Food is pretty average and healthy options are nonexistent, but I'm happy to see a full service menu.
-Service is ABYSMAL!!!

Let me illustrate our most recent experience:

Incident #1
As we were waiting at the bar for our drinks, a waitress walked by and spilled most of a beer on my sister. She did say "sorry" as she continued to walk by. A minute or two later she came back and apologized to ME, as my sister stood behind me  emptying liquid from her shoe. Accidents happen, but we both thought this was at least worth a free drink.

Incident #2 (different server)
Sister: This seems like a fun place to see live music. What types of bands play here?
Server: I don't know
Sister: When do you usually have bands?
Server: I don't know
Future Husband: What beers do you have on draft?
Server: I don't know.

Incident #3
It's been quite a while since we last saw our server, but when he finally comes back I order "chicken strips with a side of ranch and barbeque sauce." 45 minutes later the food comes out drenched in barbeque sauce.
Me: Hey, I think I have the wrong order.
Server: No, you ordered chicken strips with barbeque sauce.
Me: No, I ordered chicken strips with a side of barbeque sauce. Can I just get regular chicken strips?
Server: This is what you ordered. You didn't say "side of barbeque sauce." 
He continues to argue and finally agrees to fix the order.
Server: You need to understand that the chicken strips are going to come out exactly the same way. I just want to make sure we're on the same wavelength.
Me: Obviously we're not on the same wavelength. Will they be covered in sauce?
This whole thing was ridiculous. I'm pretty sure that Serving 101 is don't continue to argue with the customer.

Incident #4 (at the table next to us)
Server puts down glass of white wine.
Woman: I ordered pinot noir.
Server: This is pinot noir.
Woman: No, I ordered red wine.
Server: Are you sure?

Obviously our night was a fairly extreme case of bad service, but this isn't too far from the norm. We've been coming here for years and it's always been this way.

This place is the biggest joke ever!!! Went in, it took over 45 minutes to be acknowledge. And once we received our beers, it took another 30 - 45 minutes for them to come over and bring us another one. When we went up to the bar, they wouldn't give us the time of day. Our friends ordered shots of Jim Bean and they were told that they didn't have that in the bar. There was a bottle of Jim Bean sitting with the other liquor behind the bartender. The bar staff was super rude and completely inattentive. This is literally the worse bar I have ever been in. If they are that short staffed on a Friday or Saturday night, maybe they should hire more PEO rather than making the customers suffer. This is the first and last time I will ever step foot in this bar again. We waited for over 30 minutes for our bill and after asking 3 times for it, we walked out and didn't pay our bill. I don't understand how this place could be fun or the IT place to go to. People are rude and super intoxicated and the security does nothing to control the idiots that are there drinking. And the fact you pay $5+ for a burger or hot dog you have to cook yourself is ridiculous. Then you have to tip on top of it. Total waste of money and time. Avoid this place like the plague.
